definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to proceed with sth even though scared/to put on a brave face

sentences.english: Objective To optimize the prescription and technology of Brucea javanica oil subnanoemulsion injection.
sentences.chinese: 目的确定鸦胆子油亚纳米乳注射液的处方和制备工艺。

sentences.english: They are fearless and are very easy to train. The country of origin of this breed is Germany.
sentences.chinese: 这种狗胆子很大，非常容易训练，原产地是德国。

sentences.english: Abstract:ObjeTo optimize the prescription and technology of Brucea javanica oil subnanoemulsion injection.
sentences.chinese: 目的确定鸦胆子油亚纳米乳注射液的处方和制备工艺。

sentences.english: Conclusion The physical stability of Brucea javanica oil subnanoemulsion injection is good.
sentences.chinese: 结论制得的鸦胆子油亚纳米乳注射液物理稳定性良好。

sentences.english: The little girl is as timid as a hare, shy in the presence of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 这小姑娘胆子特别小，怕人。

sentences.english: Eugenie recklessly offered her father grapes.
sentences.chinese: 欧也妮大着胆子请父亲吃葡萄。

sentences.english: These Chinese medicines also possessed a strong ability to eliminate the free radical.
sentences.chinese: 鸦胆子及合剂治疗组清除氧自由基能力较强。

sentences.english: Mrs. Quilp dared only make a gesture of entreaty.
sentences.chinese: 奎尔普太太仅能大着胆子做出一种哀求的姿势。

sentences.english: others will resent you for having the guts to actually do something.
sentences.chinese: 其他人还会怨恨你，因为你有放手去做的胆子。

sentences.english: A big bird dog, bolder than others, darted in.
sentences.chinese: 一只大个头猎鸟犬胆子较大，猛扑了上去。

sentences.english: It emboldened me to ask a question.
sentences.chinese: 于是我大着胆子问了个问题。

sentences.english: Joe, a clumsy and timid horseman, did not look to advantage in the saddle.
sentences.chinese: 乔胆子小，骑术又拙，骑在鞍子上老不象样。

sentences.english: In fact she was so kind to me that I became brave enough to ask a question.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，她待我很好，我竟壮着胆子问了她一个问题。

sentences.english: If men knew all that women think, they'd be twenty times more daring. –A. Karr
sentences.chinese: 要是男的知道女的怎样想，他们的胆子会大上二十倍。

sentences.english: Mrs. Quilp durst only make a gesture of entreaty.
sentences.chinese: 奎尔普太太仅能大着胆子做出一种哀求的姿势。

definition: lit. to stroke the tiger's whiskers/to do sth very daring
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
